title: Ulysses S Grant National Historic Site: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth         Junior Ranger Logo National Park Service  Junior Ranger Program The park offers free Junior Ranger programs for children ages 5 and up. Youth will complete activities as they visit the house, explore the museum, and visit with park staff. After finishing the program requirements, the child is sworn in as a Junior Ranger and receives a special badge. Check in with the staff at the information desk to get a booklet and get started on this fun program!  There is also a Junior Ranger patch available for sale at the information desk.     Every Day at the Park  There are many fun opportunities for kids at Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site.  Becoming a Junior Ranger is a great place to start. Be sure to also check out the NPS WebRangers web page for a wonderful online experience!       Junior Ranger Booklet cover image.        Civil War to Civil Rights Trading Cards Ulysses S. Grant NHS's trading cards are here! Visit the site, explore, and ask questions to earn your card today. For information about the trading cards, click on the "Trading Cards" link on the left.       Junior Ranger Archeology Program Are you interested in Archeology and are at least 6 years old? The Midwest Archeological Center offers a Junior Ranger Archeology Program. The workbook is offered on their website and can be completed at home. Click here to go to their website.
